page.title: 11GEOLOGY, HAILES
page.content: The area is typical of the Cotswold Scarp. The inferior oolite which outcrops at Cleeve Hill appears again to the East of the Vale of Winchcombe, forming the impressive summit of Salter's Hill. The scarp with its well drained soils attracted much early settlement; Beckbury Camp (Grid reference 064 298) and the tumuli at Stumps Cross (Grid reference 076 305) are evidence of the importance of these hill-top locations. The contrast between the poor quality soils on the oolite and the heavier, more fertile middle and lower lias clays is clearly shown by the change in farming patterns and settlement. This contrast is masked by the increasing acreage of arable crops planted on the marginal upland soils. (Continued on next page).
